name: SnapBill
tag_list: billing, invoicing, saas, financial, business, siliconcape
overview:
SnapBill is an online invoicing and automated billing system that allows you to easily sell your services online. SnapBill is perfect for businesses requiring automated recurring billing or subscription billing with payment collection facilities.

You may customise SnapBill to fully suit your brand, send invoices, manage clients, process payments and efficiently automate all your billing requirements. SnapBill presents your data in a user-friendly manner and allows you to modify, query, manage and monitor clients, services, invoices and payment collections.

SnapBill offers a comprehensive mix of invoicing, billing, client management and payment collection features. It has integrated service provisioning functionality so you may add and sell your own services through SnapBill while it fully automates your recurring and subscription billing.

SnapBill is secure, automated and always available. Use it anywhere in the world, from any web enabled device and at any time.

SnapBill is the brainchild of South African founders, Jaco van Wyk and Josh Yudaken. With an extensive history of constructive co-operation, they founded and launched SnapBill in March 2010. The pair first collaborated in 2004, when they teamed up to develop and launch Lusion AHS â€“ an automated website hosting and billing system geared towards managing the needs of their own web hosting clients at Lusion Technologies.

The SnapBill founders identified the need for an online billing system developed with automation in mind and extendable to meet any businesses billing needs. The focus quickly fell on developing Lusion AHS into just such a system. Lusion AHS was subsequently guided into becoming the SnapBill of today through several years of industry use and improvement.

SnapBill has followed an organic evolution from specialised automated hosting system to comprehensive online invoicing, billing and service provisioning system with powerful recurring billing capabilities.

SnapBill was opened for pre-registration in February 2010 and launched for full South African trials in March 2010. In the months since its South African launch SnapBill acquired over 1000 active South African SME and Enterprise users.

Some SnapBill users bill over 20000 clients and R100 million (+- USD 15 million) per month.

Due to the positive uptake in South Africa, thorough user testing, detailed debugging and extensive feature refinement have been possible. The end result; a fully featured, robust system capable of handing anything users can throw at it.

SnapBill was opened for selective international pre-registrations in February 2011 and will be launched internationally in March 2011.
